solution_line_template: Helga writes {articles_per_30_min} x {multiplier_for_articles_per_hour} = <<{articles_per_30_min}*{multiplier_for_articles_per_hour}={articles_per_hour}>>{articles_per_hour} articles per hour.
And she can write {articles_per_hour} x {daily_work_hours} = <<{articles_per_hour}*{daily_work_hours}={articles_per_day_usual}>>{articles_per_day_usual} articles every {daily_work_hours} hours.

So, the total number of articles she usually writes for a week is {articles_per_day_usual} x {usual_work_days_per_week} = <<{articles_per_day_usual}*{usual_work_days_per_week}={articles_per_week_usual}>>{articles_per_week_usual} articles.

She was able to write {articles_per_hour} x {extra_hours_thursday} = <<{articles_per_hour}*{extra_hours_thursday}={articles_extra_thursday}>>{articles_extra_thursday} articles on her extra {extra_hours_thursday} hours last Thursday.

And she was able to write {articles_per_hour} x {extra_hours_friday} = <<{articles_per_hour}*{extra_hours_friday}={articles_extra_friday}>>{articles_extra_friday} articles on her extra hour last Friday.

So, the total number of articles she was able to write on her extra hours is {articles_extra_thursday} + {articles_extra_friday}= <<{articles_extra_thursday}+{articles_extra_friday}={total_extra_articles}>>{total_extra_articles}.

Therefore, she was able to write a total of {articles_per_week_usual} + {total_extra_articles} = <<{articles_per_week_usual}+{total_extra_articles}={total_articles_this_week}>>{total_articles_this_week} this week.
